metadata.title: CVE-2017-5081 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Lack of verification of an extension's locale folder in Google Chrome priorto 59.0.3071.86 for Mac, Windows, and Linux, and 59.0.3071.92 for Android,allowed an attacker with local write access to modify extensions bymodifying extension files.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5081` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.14.04.1186
chromium-browser-l10n - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.14.04.1186
chromium-chromedriver - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.14.04.1186
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.14.04.1186
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.14.04.1186
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.14.04.1186').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
